json.text: Hi there! This is Mark from MarkTeacher.com with another high band IELTS example
answer. This IELTS question is all about companies. What's the difference between
Generally speaking, big firms often have different offices or branches across the
country, or if they're a multinational business, they may have representatives
across the world. Big companies tend to have more revenue so they can hire more
employees - they can have bigger teams and they can make deals and conglomerates
with other companies. I mean they can merge businesses together to become even
more influential and successful. In terms of small companies, they obviously have
less money to play with, so they probably deal with much smaller members of staff
they might also have smaller offices on smaller workplaces with fewer employees,
and I think their power and influence is much more limited due to the size of
their business. Independent businesses are quite common and usually operate out
of single story or single room offices. So I think those are some of the key
differences between large and small businesses. check out MarkTeacher.com
for more IELTS courses lessons and tips!
